content: We used to have underlining or something in the left sidebar for when hovering over topcis. I think we do need something; underlining, highlighting, etc., to make it easy to see the target you're clicking on. Thoughts on what this could be?
One cue that that's still there is the chevron, which only shows on hover. If we had a little more prominent icon there, I think it would catch people's eye.

Changing the background on hover is also a good option.
hover_topic.gif
@Akash Nimare I think that's how it used to work, and I don't recall ever hearing major complaints about the old approach.
Looks like this is from https://github.com/zulip/zulip/commit/953ee778f332c2bad99ffcbcbac98ef5ff449616. I'd be fine with reverting that until we have a solution for the topics. @Brock Whittaker?

From that commit message:

This is acceptable due to the fact that hover is signified already by a light grey background.

Which I agree with, but seems not to be true in the case of topics within a stream.
Light grey background also appears when hovering over the current topic but not on other topics in the same stream.
It looks like this hasn't been fixed yet?
